name: Bed mobilization frequency
functionStatement: Peak flows reshape channel without chronic instability, redistribute wood and sediment, reset habitats, and supply nutrients to floodplains.
descriptionMarkdown: Bed sediments mobilize near bankfull (~1-2 yr), maintaining a stable but dynamic channel.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Estimate critical discharge from Shields using D50 and compare to flood recurrence estimates. Use qualitative checks where data are limited.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Bed rarely moves even in large events, or reworks dramatically during modest events.
Criteria: Extreme mismatch

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Bed stays locked through multiple moderate floods, or mobilizes during sub-bankfull flows every season.
Criteria: Often locked or often scoured

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Motion occurs somewhat below or above bankfull. Habitat still diverse but trending.
Criteria: Slightly off

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Painted tracers or pebble counts indicate surface mobility near bankfull. Historic records show similar behavior.
Criteria: Motion near bankfull (~1-2 yr)

references: USGS PeakFQ or flow-frequency statistics (where available)
